dcterms:description: The OPP dataset is one of the most challenging wearable-based HAR datasets, which exhibits imbalanced class distributions. It includes 18 daily kitchen activities collected from five runs of four subjects at a sampling rate of 30 Hz.
dcterms:title: Opportunity (OPP)

dcterms:creator: Attila Reiss
Didier Stricker
dcterms:description: The PAMAP2 dataset is one of the most widely used wearable-based HAR datasets, which includes 12 daily activities collected from nine subjects. It includes IMU recordings from hand, chest, and ankle with accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer, temperature, and heart rate information.
dcterms:title: Physical Activity Monitoring (PAMAP2)

dcterms:description: GOTOV is one of the most recent HAR datasets, with activities collected from older-age subjects. It has 16 daily activities collected from thirty-five participants, with accelerometer sensors worn at three locations: ankle, chest, and wrist.
dcterms:title: Growing Old Together Validation (GOTOV)
